bullets.text: Machine learning involves teaching computers to learn from data.
It contrasts with giving computers explicit rules.
System is trained on labeled data.
Example: Identifying spam emails based on labeled examples.
Model learns patterns to predict unseen cases.
Common algorithms include decision trees, support vector machines (SVMs), and neural networks.
Unsupervised learning finds patterns in data without labels.
Example: Clustering customers into groups (e.g., K-means).
Reinforcement learning involves an agent learning from feedback or rewards in an environment.
Example: Training AI to play video games or control robots.
Overfitting: Model memorizes training data, performing poorly on new data.
Bias: Occurs when the training data itself is unbalanced or unrepresentative.
Self-driving cars: Essential for object recognition.
The next lecture will cover machine learning evaluation metrics.
Metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score.
